sound

Class ClipDelegate

  • java.lang.Object
    • sound.ClipDelegate

  • public class ClipDelegate
extends java.lang.Object
    A class with methods used to get a Clip Object to work even more easily than it already does. It requests a Clip using the most common method, the way through AudioSystem, and then forwards the default methods to the given Clip.

    For use of large sounds or when you want to add filters and effects, use the SoundManager class. That class works with the SourceDataLine and can therefore handle that.

    Since:
    10-8-2014
    Version:
    10-8-2014
    Author:
    stefanboodt
    See Also:
    Clip, AudioSystem, SoundManager

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClipDelegate

        public ClipDelegate()
             throws javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException
        Creates a new ClipDelegate. After calling this one of the methods open(AudioInputStream), open(AudioFormat, byte[], int, int) or open() should be called.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException - If there are no lines available.
        See Also:
        getClip()

      • ClipDelegate

        public ClipDelegate(javax.sound.sampled.Mixer.Info info)
             throws javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException
        Creates a new ClipDelegate with a mixer conform the given info. After calling this one of the methods open(AudioInputStream), open(AudioFormat, byte[], int, int) or open() should be called.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException - If there are no lines available.
        See Also:
        AudioSystem.getClip()
